unit_learning_outcomes.description: Understand and explain the multi-faceted nature of carrying out a STEM-based investigation, including social, cultural, economic, environmental, and personal constraints and considerations to be taken into account when developing solutions.
Demonstrate design thinking through researching, conceptualising and planning a STEM-based solution to an identified problem, need, want or opportunity.

Demonstrate understanding of how the knowledge generated from a practical STEM investigation relates to classroom STEM teaching and learning, through a reflective analysis of implications and applications.

Analyse the contribution that Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics make to the design and development of solutions to problems, needs, wants or opportunities through completing a practical STEM investigation.
Demonstrate effective practice with a range of digital technologies through their use in researching, planning, and presenting outcomes from a practical STEM task.

data.description: This unit builds students' personal conceptual knowledge of design thinking, focusing on its integration with Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics (STEM) knowledge and its application to solve authentic problems or meet needs, wants or opportunities existing in 'real world' contexts. The project-based approach requires students to research and develop a personal STEM investigation including phases of conceptualisation, design/planning, prototyping, implementation and evaluation. The unit models e-portfolio assessment as a means of collating and presenting data and information from the investigations.
data.title: Design of STEM Education
